page.title: 20LIVING IN THE AREA
page.content: The main problem of living in this area is the isolation,since public transport is so poor.As a result most households have at least 1 car & many have 2 or more.Consequently those who cannot afford or do not have their own transport(such as schoolchildren)often find it difficult to go shopping,visit friends etc.Many of the people who live in this area have retired to it, drawn by its attractive countryside & rural charm combined with nearness to London.Many of the inhabitants of the area have connections with the Navy as a result of its nearness both to Portsmouth & to inland establishments like H.M.S.Mercury.The presence of so many incomers has caused house prices to rise to high levels so that many locals & young married couples cannot now afford to buy their own property.
